title: Travis Scott addresses 'what's real' following Kylie Jenner breakup rumors
text:
CLOSE Kylie Jenner cleared the air about rumors she went on a "date" with her ex-boyfriend, Tyga. Jenner also addressed her rumored breakup with Travis Scott. USA TODAY

Travis Scott is breaking his silence.

A day after Kylie Jenner said the pair are focusing on their "friendship" following break-up rumors, the Houston-born rapper took to his Instagram Story to share "what's real."

"(It's) really affecting when u see false things said about u," Scott, 28, wrote Friday. "Once again, these false stories about me cheating are simply not true. Focusing on life, music, and family at this moment is what's real."

Jenner released a similar statement on Twitter Thursday, writing, "Travis and I are on great terms and our main focus right now is Stormi."

The 22-year-old reality star added: "Our friendship and our daughter is priority."

Travis and i are on great terms and our main focus right now is Stormi ‼️ our friendship and our daughter is priority — Kylie Jenner (@KylieJenner) October 3, 2019

Jenner posted a statement regarding recent tabloid headlines, which reported she was seen spending time with 29-year-old rapper Tyga, her ex-boyfriend.

"The internet makes everything 100 times more dramatic than what it really is," she tweeted Thursday. "There was no '2am date with Tyga.' You see me drop two of my friends off at a studio that he happened to be at."

Travis Scott and Kylie Jenner pose with daughter Stormi Webster on Aug. 27, 2019. (Photo: Jon Kopaloff, FilmMagic)

Jenner and Scott welcomed daughter Stormi in February 2018. The couple, who began dating in April 2017, shocked fans with the news of the birth, after keeping Jenner's pregnancy a secret.

Just over a month ago, Stormi made her red carpet debut with Mom and Dad at the premiere of Scott's Netflix documentary, "Look Mom I Can Fly."

At one point in the documentary, Travis volunteers to cut the umbilical cord after Stormi's birth. His kid returns the love in the hospital, crying when any human other than her mother or father tries to comfort her.

Scott describes the scene in the documentary where a nurse cannot calm Stormi, nor can Kylie's mother, Kris.

"She was still crying," Scott explains. "As soon as I walked over to her, she stopped crying. As soon as I walked away, started crying. They handed her to Kylie and she stopped crying."

Forbes' list of top billionaires is out: Why Kylie Jenner and Jay-Z didn't make the cut

Last week: Kylie Jenner hospitalized, will miss planned cosmetics rollout at Paris Fashion Week

description: Amid rumors that Kylie Jenner and  Travis Scott have broken up, the rapper broke his silence on Instagram telling 'what's real."
